content:
TITLE: Initializing Image Classifier in ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method initializes the imageClassifier object with optional model name, configuration options, and a callback function. It returns the imageClassifier object for further use in image classification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const imageClassifier = ml5.imageClassifier(?modelName, ?options, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing BodyPose in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Method to initialize the bodyPose object for real-time human pose estimation. It accepts optional parameters for model name, configuration options, and a callback function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose(?modelName, ?options, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing BodySegmentation in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Method to initialize the bodySegmentation object, which divides an image input into people and background. It accepts optional parameters for model name, configuration options, and a callback function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const bodySegmentation = ml5.bodySegmentation(?modelName, ?options, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing HandPose Model in ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method initializes the handPose object with optional configuration options and a callback function. It returns the handPose object for further use in hand pose estimation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const handPose = ml5.handPose(?options, ?callback);
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  maxHands: 2,
  runtime: "mediapipe",
  modelType: "full",
  solutionPath: "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@mediapipe/hands",
  detectorModelUrl: undefined, //default to use the tf.hub model
  landmarkModelUrl: undefined, //default to use the tf.hub model
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing FaceMesh in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Method to initialize the faceMesh object for real-time face landmark estimation. It accepts optional parameters for configuration options and a callback function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const faceMesh = ml5.faceMesh(?options, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Single Image Classification with ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method asynchronously outputs a single image classification on an image media when called. It takes media input, an optional number of labels to return, and an optional callback function, returning a promise that resolves to the classification output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
imageClassifier.classify(media, ?kNumber, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Continuous Image Classification with ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method repeatedly outputs classification labels on an image media through a callback function. It takes media input, an optional number of labels to return, and a callback function to handle the output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
imageClassifier.classifyStart(media, ?kNumber, callback);
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[
  {
    label: '...',
    confidence: ...
  }
  ...
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Single Hand Pose Detection with ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method asynchronously outputs a single hand estimation on an image media when called. It takes media input and an optional callback function, returning a promise that resolves to the estimation output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
handPose.detect(media, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Continuous Detection with BodyPose
DESCRIPTION: Method to continuously detect and output pose estimations on an image media through a callback function. It takes a media element and a callback function as parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bodyPose.detectStart(media, callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Detecting Face Mesh with ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method asynchronously outputs a single face estimation on an image media. It takes media input and an optional callback function, returning a promise that resolves to the estimation output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
faceMesh.detect(media, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Continuous Hand Pose Detection with ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method repeatedly outputs hand estimations on an image media through a callback function. It takes media input and a callback function to handle the output of the estimation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
handPose.detectStart(media, callback);
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[
  {
    score,
    handedness,
    keypoints: [{ x, y, score, name }, ...],
    keypoints3D: [{ x, y, z, score, name }, ...],
    index_finger_dip: { x, y, x3D, y3D, z3D },
    index_finger_mcp: { x, y, x3D, y3D, z3D },
    ...
  }
  ...
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Continuous Detection with BodySegmentation
DESCRIPTION: Method to continuously detect and output segmentation masks on an image media through a callback function. It takes a media element and a callback function as parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bodySegmentation.detectStart(media, callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Continuous Detection with FaceMesh
DESCRIPTION: Method to continuously detect and output face estimations on an image media through a callback function. It takes a media element and a callback function as parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
faceMesh.detectStart(media, callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Single Detection with BodyPose
DESCRIPTION: Method to perform a single pose estimation on an image media. It returns a promise that resolves to the estimation output and also accepts an optional callback function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bodyPose.detect(media, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Single Detection with BodySegmentation
DESCRIPTION: Method to perform a single segmentation detection on an image media. It returns a promise that resolves to the segmentation output and also accepts an optional callback function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bodySegmentation.detect(media, ?callback);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Output Format for BodyPose Detection
DESCRIPTION: Example of the output format from the bodyPose detection methods. The output includes bounding box, keypoints, and specific body part positions with confidence scores.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[
  {
    box: { width, height, xMax, xMin, yMax, yMin },
    id: 1,
    keypoints: [{ x, y, score, name }, ...],
    left_ankle: { x, y, confidence },
    left_ear: { x, y, confidence },
    left_elbow: { x, y, confidence },
    ...
    score: 0.28,
  },
  ...
];
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Output Format for FaceMesh Detection
DESCRIPTION: Example of the output format from the faceMesh detection methods. The output includes bounding box, keypoints, and specific facial feature positions in 3D coordinates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[
  {
    box: { width, height, xMax, xMin, yMax, yMin },
    keypoints: [{x, y, z, name}, ... ],
    faceOval: [{x, y, z}, ...],
    leftEye: [{x, y, z}, ...],
    ...
  },
  ...
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Output Format for BodySegmentation Detection
DESCRIPTION: Example of the output format from the bodySegmentation detection methods. The output includes a mask image as a p5 Image object and maskImageData as an ImageData object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  mask: {},//A p5 Image object, can be directly passed into p5 image() function
  maskImageData: {}//A ImageData object
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Options for MoveNet Model in BodyPose
DESCRIPTION: Example of the configuration options object for the MoveNet model in bodyPose. These options control model type, smoothing, tracking, and various thresholds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  modelType: "MULTIPOSE_LIGHTNING", // "MULTIPOSE_LIGHTNING", "SINGLEPOSE_LIGHTNING", or "SINGLEPOSE_THUNDER"
  enableSmoothing: true,
  minPoseScore: 0.25,
  multiPoseMaxDimension: 256,
  enableTracking: true,
  trackerType: "boundingBox", // "keypoint" or "boundingBox"
  trackerConfig: {},
  modelUrl: undefined,
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Options for BlazePose Model in BodyPose
DESCRIPTION: Example of the configuration options object for the BlazePose model in bodyPose. These options control runtime environment, model type, smoothing, and model URLs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  runtime: "mediapipe", // "mediapipe" or "tfjs"
  enableSmoothing: true,
  modelType: "full", // "lite", "full", or "heavy"
  detectorModelUrl: undefined, //default to use the tf.hub model
  landmarkModelUrl: undefined, //default to use the tf.hub model
  solutionPath: "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@mediapipe/pose",
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Options for FaceMesh
DESCRIPTION: Example of the configuration options object for the faceMesh model. These options control the maximum number of faces to detect, landmark refinement, and horizontal flipping.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
    maxFaces: 1,
    refineLandmarks: false,
    flipHorizontal: false
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including ml5.js v0.6.1 Example
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides a concrete example of including ml5.js version 0.6.1 in an HTML document using a script tag that references the minified library from unpkg CDN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/ml5@0.6.1/dist/ml5.min.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration Options for BodySegmentation
DESCRIPTION: Example of the configuration options object for the bodySegmentation model. These options control the runtime environment, model type, and mask type for the segmentation output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  runtime: "mediapipe", // "mediapipe" or "tfjs"
  modelType: "general", // "general" or "landscape"
  maskType: "background", //"background", "body", or "parts" (used to change the type of segmentation mask output)
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Image Classification in ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method can be called after a call to imageClassifier.classifyStart to stop the repeating classifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
imageClassifier.classifyStop();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Hand Pose Detection in ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: This method can be called after a call to handPose.detectStart to stop the repeating hand estimation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
handPose.detectStop();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Continuous Detection with FaceMesh
DESCRIPTION: Method to stop the continuous detection process started by faceMesh.detectStart(). This should be called when detection is no longer needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
faceMesh.detectStop();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Continuous Detection with BodyPose
DESCRIPTION: Method to stop the continuous detection process started by bodyPose.detectStart(). This should be called when detection is no longer needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bodyPose.detectStop();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Continuous Detection with BodySegmentation
DESCRIPTION: Method to stop the continuous detection process started by bodySegmentation.detectStart(). This should be called when detection is no longer needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bodySegmentation.detectStop();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including ml5.js Alpha Release in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Script tag to include the ml5.js alpha release library (version 0.20.0-alpha.4) in an HTML file. This script tag should be added to the HTML file to load the library from the unpkg CDN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/documentation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/ml5@0.20.0-alpha.4/dist/ml5.min.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing ML5 Model Factory Functions
DESCRIPTION: Examples of instantiating ML5 model objects using factory functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose("BlazePose");
let neuralNetwork = ml5.neuralNetwork();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Dynamic Rules with Functions in ML5.js
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to use functions for dynamic rule evaluation in moldObject. Shows runtime-dependent validation for maxHands parameter where the default value changes based on the selected runtime environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const mold = {
  runtime: {
    type: "enum",
    enums: ["mediapipe", "tfjs"],
    default: "mediapipe",
  },
  maxHands: {
    type: "number",
    min: 1,
    default: (filteredObject) => filteredObject.runtime === "mediapipe" ? 4 : 2;
  },
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ML5 Options Handling Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Example of using handleOptions utility to filter user-defined options based on rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const filteredOptions = handleOptions(userObject, moldObject);

const optionsObject = {
  maxHands: 4,
  modelType: full,
};

const mold = {
  maxHands: {
    type: "number",
    min: 1,
    default: 2,
  },
  runtime: {
    type: "enum",
    enums: ["mediapipe", "tfjs"],
    default: "mediapipe",
  },
  modelType: {
    type: "enum",
    enums: ["lite", "full"],
    default: "full",
  },
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ML5 Parameter Order Flexibility
DESCRIPTION: Examples demonstrating flexible parameter ordering in ML5 functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose("blazepose", { modelType: "full" });

let bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose({ modelType: "full" }, "blazepose");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring ML5 BodyPose with Options
DESCRIPTION: Examples showing case-insensitive parameter handling in ML5.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose("BlazePose", { modelType: "Full" });

let bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose("blazepose", { modelType: "full" });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ML5 Error Handling Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing ML5's friendly warning system for invalid parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let bodyPose = ml5.bodyPose({ modelType: "foo" });
// Console:
// üü™ml5.js warns: The 'modelType' option for bodyPose has to be set to 'lite', 'full', or 'heavy', but it is being set to 'foo' instead.
//
// ml5.js is using default value of 'full'.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building ml5.js Library for Production
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build the ml5.js library for production use. This creates optimized distribution files in the /dist directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
yarn
yarn run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies and Starting Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install project dependencies using Yarn and start the development server for local testing of the ml5.js library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
yarn
yarn start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Formatting Code Using Prettier CLI
DESCRIPTION: Commands to format JavaScript code using Prettier from the command line. This ensures consistent code style across the ml5.js codebase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
yarn run format
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Formatting Specific Files Using Prettier CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to format a specific file using Prettier from the command line, allowing for targeted code formatting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npx prettier --write path/to/file
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring p5 Web Editor Environment
DESCRIPTION: Environment configuration file setup for p5 Web Editor authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
P5_USERNAME=<p5 web editor username here>
P5_PASSWORD=<p5 web editor password here>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Corepack for Yarn Package Manager
DESCRIPTION: Command to enable Corepack, which is required for using Yarn as the package manager for ml5.js development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
corepack enable
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Node.js using nvm for macOS and Linux
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install and use the correct Node.js version with nvm for macOS and Linux environments. This ensures compatibility with the ml5.js development environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
nvm install
nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Node.js using nvm-windows for Windows
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install and use the correct Node.js version with nvm-windows for Windows environments. This ensures compatibility with the ml5.js development environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
nvm install 20
nvm use 20
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including a Specific Version of ml5.js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to include a specific version of the ml5.js library by replacing <version> with the desired version number in the script tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/ml5@<version>/dist/ml5.min.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including ml5.js v1.2.1 in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to include the ml5.js library (version 1.2.1) in an HTML document by adding a script tag in the head section that references the CDN-hosted library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/ml5@1.2.1/dist/ml5.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ML5.js License Terms in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Complete markdown formatted license text that defines usage terms, code of conduct compliance requirements, copyright provisions, and liability limitations for the ML5.js project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/LICENSE.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# ml5.js LICENSE

_Version 1.0 of the ml5.js license was adopted and last updated on May 10, 2021. It applies to all contributions to the ml5.js library as of May 20,2021. Contributions prior to that date are licensed under the MIT license. You can read the blog post announcing and explaining the development of the license [here](https://ml5js.medium.com/6b0e4c109b76)._

## Purpose

This license gives everyone as much permission to work with this software as possible as long as they comply with the ml5.js [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/ml5js/Code-of-Conduct), while protecting contributors from liability.

## Acceptance

In order to receive this license, you must agree to its rules. The rules of this license are both obligations under that agreement and conditions to your license. You must not do anything with this software that triggers a rule that you cannot or will not follow.

## Copyright

Each contributor licenses you to do everything with this software that would otherwise infringe that contributor's copyright in it.

## License Reversion

Each contribution to this software is licensed under this license for three years from the date it is contributed to the software. After that three year period the contribution is licensed under the [Blue Oak Model License v 1.0.0](https://blueoakcouncil.org/license/1.0.0).

## Code of Conduct

You must use this software in compliance with the ml5.js [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/ml5js/Code-of-Conduct) as it exists at the time of your use. This includes cooperating with any investigations of your compliance with the ml5.js Code of Conduct.

## Notices

You must ensure that everyone who gets a copy of any part of this software from you, with or without changes, also gets the text of this license or a link to https://ml5js.org/license.

## Excuse

If anyone notifies you in writing that you have not complied with [Notices](https://github.com/ml5js/Code-of-Conduct/blob/main/LICENSE.md#notices), you can keep your license by taking all practical steps to comply within 30 days after the notice. If you do not do so, your license ends immediately.

If anyone notifies you in writing that you have not complied with the Code of Conduct, you can keep your license by taking all practical steps to comply within 30 days after the notice. If you do not do so, and the ml5.js Code of Conduct Committee (or its equivalent or successor) agrees that you are in violation of the Code of Conduct, your license ends immediately.

## Patent

Each contributor licenses you to do everything with this software that would otherwise infringe any patent claims they can license or become able to license.

## Reliability

No contributor can revoke this license.

## No Liability

**_As far as the law allows, this software comes as is, without any warranty or condition, and no contributor will be liable to anyone for any damages related to this software or this license, under any kind of legal claim._**

## Permission

Each contributor licenses you to do everything with this license that would otherwise infringe that contributor's copyright in it.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including Latest Version of ml5.js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to include the latest version of ml5.js, though it's not recommended as code may break with updates. It uses the 'latest' tag in the script source URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/ml5@latest/dist/ml5.min.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rendering Contributors Table in HTML
DESCRIPTION: HTML table markup for displaying project contributors with their avatars, names, and contribution types. Each contributor entry includes their GitHub avatar, profile link, and contribution emojis indicating their type of contributions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ml5js/ml5-next-gen/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
